turns.content: [Moon woke up the next day, feeling comfortable and safe in Hemlock’s arms. She yawned softly.]

Hemlock stirred in his sleep and opened his eyes, noticing that Moon was awake. He smiled softly and rubbed her back. "Good morning," he said quietly.

Moon stretched her limbs and smiled at Hemlock. "Good morning," she replied. "Thank you for last night. I don't remember the last time I felt so safe."

Hemlock kissed the top of her head. "Of course, Moon. You don't have to thank me," he said. "I'll always be here for you."

Moon's heart swelled with emotion, and she looked up at Hemlock. "You know, last night when you confessed... I didn't know what to say at first," she admitted. "But I feel the same way, Hemlock. I really care about you."

Hemlock smiled and stroked her hair gently. "I know," he said softly. "And I'm so glad to hear it."

Moon leaned in for a gentle kiss, and Hemlock kissed her back tenderly. They pulled away, and Hemlock stood up, carrying Moon with him. "Come on, let's get you some breakfast," he said, carrying her to the kitchen.

Moon giggled and wrapped her arms around Hemlock's neck, feeling grateful for his care and affection. As they walked to the kitchen, she knew that she could always count on Hemlock to be there for her, and that made her heart soar.

“I may be tired, but I can walk Hem,” Moon joked.
[Tom spotted them and walked over. Not many people were up so early in the morning at the base.]
“Aw, look at you two,” Tom teased.

Hemlock groaned and shifted, finally opening his eyes. He looked up at Tom and gave him a small smile. "Good morning," he said before turning his attention back to Moon. "Are you feeling alright?" he asked, concern lacing his voice.

Moon nodded, feeling a bit embarrassed at their current position. "Yeah, I feel good. Just a little tired," she replied, sitting up in Hemlock's arms.

Tom chuckled at their reaction. "Sorry to interrupt your morning cuddles. But we need to get started on some things before the rest of the team wakes up," he said, still teasing.

Hemlock sighed but nodded. "Right, let's get going," he said, carefully helping Moon to her feet before standing up himself.

Moon smiled at him gratefully, feeling a warm sense of comfort from the night before. As they made their way back to the base, she couldn't help but feel grateful for having such supportive and caring teammates.
“Alright, so what’s up Tom?” Moon asked as Hemlock got up and stood by her.

Tom chuckled. "Well, it's not every day I see Hemlock carrying someone around like a princess," he teased, earning a playful punch from Hemlock.

Ignoring their banter, Tom's expression turned serious. "I got word from some of my contacts. The government's planning a major strike on one of our supply depots in a few days. We need to act fast to prevent it."

Moon's face twisted in concern. "Do we have any specifics? Where is the depot located?"

Tom shook his head. "Not yet. But I have someone on the inside working on it. We should know more soon."

Hemlock crossed his arms, his brow furrowed in thought. "We'll need to rally the troops and set up some defenses. We can't let them take us by surprise."

Moon nodded in agreement. "I'll get started on coordinating with the others. Let's not waste any time."

Tom gave them a nod. "I'll keep working on getting more intel. We'll need all the help we can get."

As Tom left to continue his work, Moon turned to Hemlock. "We've got a lot of work to do. You ready for this?"

Hemlock smiled confidently. "Always. Let's do this."

[The trio had been laughing at a joke Tom told, Moon calmed herself and sighed.]
“I wonder how my brother Charlie would think about me now… he did call me the quiet sibling, but I had a good relationship with him…”

Hemlock put his hand on Moon's shoulder in comfort. "I'm sure he'd be proud of you, Moon. You've come a long way since then and you're doing important work here. And we're all here to support you."

Tom nodded in agreement. "Yeah, we've got your back. And I'm sure Charlie would be amazed at all the amazing things you've accomplished."

Moon smiled gratefully at them. "Thanks, guys. It's just sometimes I wonder if I'm doing enough, if I'm making a difference."

Hemlock smiled reassuringly. "You definitely are. And we're all in this together. We'll make a difference together."

Moon nodded, feeling a sense of warmth and support from her teammates. She knew she was lucky to have them.

[Moon checked the clock, then noticed the time and stood.]
“Im sorry guys, I scheduled an appointment with Prof. Maximus, it’s in fifteen…”

“No problem Moon, we’ll hold down the fort here,” Hemlock said with a reassuring smile.

Tom nodded in agreement. “Yeah, you go take care of what you need to. We’ll catch up with you later.”

“Thanks, guys,” Moon said as she grabbed her bag and headed out of the room.

[Moon leaned back in the chair.]
“And you also wanted to run a few tests to see if there was any lingering effects from the virus?”

Prof. Maximus nodded. "Yes, that's right. We want to make sure that there aren't any lasting effects from the virus, and that your body is functioning properly." He leaned forward and began to prepare some paperwork. "I have a few forms for you to fill out, and then we can start the testing."

Moon took the forms and began to fill them out, writing down her medical history and any symptoms she had experienced since being infected with the virus. As she filled out the paperwork, she couldn't help but feel a sense of anxiety. She had never been particularly fond of doctors or medical exams, and the thought of having to go through a battery of tests made her uneasy.

Prof. Maximus noticed her unease and smiled reassuringly. "Don't worry, Moon. We're just being cautious. I'm sure everything will be fine."

Moon nodded and finished filling out the forms. After a few minutes, Prof. Maximus led her to a nearby examination room, where he began to perform various tests on her. He checked her blood pressure, listened to her heart and lungs, and performed several neurological tests to check for any signs of cognitive impairment.

Throughout the testing, Moon tried to stay calm and focused. She reminded herself that these tests were necessary and that they would give her a better understanding of her overall health. After about an hour, the testing was complete.

"Well, everything looks good," Prof. Maximus said, looking over the results. "Your blood pressure is a little high, but that's to be expected given your recent experiences. Other than that, your results are all normal."

Moon breathed a sigh of relief. "That's good to hear."

Prof. Maximus smiled. "Yes, it is. But I still want to see you back here in a few weeks for a follow-up, just to be safe."

Moon nodded. "Of course. Thank you, Prof. Maximus."

As Moon left the office and made her way back to the base, she felt a sense of relief wash over her. Despite her anxiety, the testing had gone well, and she was reassured that she was in good health. She made a mental note to take care of herself in the coming weeks, to keep her blood pressure under control and to maintain her overall health.
[Moon walked back into the Trio’s office and greeted Tom and Hemlock.]

Tom looked up from his computer and smiled at Moon. "Hey, how did the appointment go?"

Moon sat down in her chair and sighed. "It went well. Just some routine tests to make sure everything's okay after my exposure to the virus."

Hemlock leaned forward in his chair. "And? Did everything come back clear?"

Moon nodded. "Yes, thankfully. No lingering effects or anything like that."

Tom gave a small smile. "That's great news, Moon."

[Moon smiled]
"Yeah, it really is. Now what's our progress?"

Tom spoke up, "Well, we've made some headway on deciphering Blackwatch's communication codes. We've also managed to recruit a few more people to our cause."

Hemlock added, "We've also been working on improving our weapons and gear. I think we're making good progress there."

Moon nodded, "That's great to hear. I've been reviewing the intel we gathered on the Blackwatch lab. We need to come up with a plan to get inside and destroy it."

Tom leaned forward, "I've been thinking about that. We could use the codes we've decrypted to get inside without alerting anyone. Then we could plant some explosives and take out the lab."

Hemlock nodded in agreement, "That sounds like a solid plan. We'll need to make sure we have enough manpower and supplies for the mission, though."

Moon smiled, "We can work on that. I'll start reaching out to some of the contacts I've made to see if they're willing to help. And we can start gathering supplies and weapons."

The trio spent the rest of the day discussing their plans and making preparations for the mission. They knew it would be risky, but it was worth it to take down Blackwatch and put a stop to their evil experiments.
